title: How to Mix and Match Your Favorite TV Channels With DIRECTVโs GenreยPacks
summary: Starting at $19.99/mo., create your favorite channel lineup of sports, news, movies, family-friendly networks and more.
body: All products and services featured are independently chosen by editors. However, Billboard may receive a commission on orders placed through its retail links, and the retailer may receive certain auditable data for accounting purposes. Right in time for the holidays, DIRECTV is offering subscribers more flexibility to create the perfect channel lineup built to match the content you love, minus everything else. With the launch of Genre Packs , users can now mix and match their favorite types of channels like sports, news, movies, or family-friendly networks all-in-one place. Starting at $19.99/mo. , pay for the TV lineup you love without bulking up on unwanted channels and services. As of now, DIRECTV is offering five Genre Packs, including MyEntertainment, MySports, MyKids, MyNews and MiEspaรฑol. In addition, there are also three Mini-pack add-ons (starting at $9.99/mo.) MySports Extra, MyCinema, and MyHome Team, which offer smaller content lineups to complete your favorite genre selection. sign up for directv here Take a look at a breakdown of each Genre and Mini- pack below and then mix and match your favorite themes to create your perfect TV lineup. DirecTV Genre Packs: MyEntertโฆ

title: YouTube TVโs new plans are the ร la carte fix we needed
summary: YouTube TV will finally let you pay for just sports or news in a major bundle breakup.
body: Credit: Joe Maring / Android Authority TL;DR YouTube TV is launching over 10 new genre-specific plans in early 2026. The sports plan delivers major networks, FS1, NBC Sports, all of ESPN, plus access to ESPN Unlimited. Other options include news, family, and entertainment packages tailored to specific interests. Streaming was supposed to help people cut the cord and save. But as live TV bundles got more expensive, that promise faded. Now, YouTube TV is trying something new. Starting in early 2026, the service will move away from its one-size-fits-everything model and roll out a lineup of ร-la-carte plans built around what people actually watch . So, instead of forcing everyone into a single, pricey base plan โ currently $82.99 per month โ YouTube TV is launching over 10 genre-specific packages.
